intro: Pedicularis sceptrum-carolinum, commonly known as the American monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers with a distinctive hooded structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. It is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms in late spring to early summer.
